body:
@harupy Would you like to provide some help for the user ? 
This is similar to the previous issue you replied https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/5659
@njanopoulos What does your tracking URI look like? Can you replace sensitive information with random strings and share it with us?

> I have determined that it expects to use local creds when running on localhost instead of the ones on the Tracking Server.

It depends on the artifact URI of the experiment. Can you print it out with `mlflow.get_artifact_uri` and check where it points to?

Thank you for the reply.

print(mlflow.get_tracking_uri())
https://mlflow-ui-test-namespace.apps.aws.aws.com/

print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri())
s3://bucket/folder/mlflow/829a287526a3437e9860885f51b5c394/artifacts

Please note the following:
- These values are the same when running from localhost and from Tracking Server. It all works from Tracking Server.
- mlflow.log_param & mlflow.log_metric are working from localhost. It's only the log_artifact that is not working.
- Tracking Server is running from a POD in Kubernetes

I am having a similar issue as described here. Also running tracking server on kubernetes, with:

```
mlflow server \
    --host 0.0.0.0 \
    --port 5000 \
    --backend-store-uri postgresql://user:pw@endpoint \
    --artifacts-destination s3://folder/artifacts/ \
    --serve-artifacts \
    --default-artifact-root s3://folder/artifacts/ \
``` 

When I run `print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri())`, I get a similar output as @njanopoulos:

```
s3://folder/artifacts/4/49712sf7b542594f7ab312412asr4ae7c84/artifacts
```
however, according to [this comment](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/5659#issuecomment-1096633208) in #5659 , it should probably be `mlflow-artifacts://...` ("proxy URI") instead of `s3://...`, which is also indicated in the [docs](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#scenario-5-mlflow-tracking-server-enabled-with-proxied-artifact-storage-access):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23722371/177714047-6af0a2ba-690b-45d0-a719-e0b3f202c041.png)

Does this help to identify the issue? Are any settings missing?
@bkolb249 Can you try creating a new experiment and check where its artifact location points to?
The output from above is from a new experiment (indicated in the logs by `2022/07/07 09:00:04 INFO mlflow.tracking.fluent: Experiment with name 'test5' does not exist. Creating a new experiment.`)
@bkolb249 Can you check the experiment artifact URI?

Is the *experiment artifact URI* different from the *artifact URI*, i.e. the output I get from `print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri())`? The output of latter command is:
`s3://folder/artifacts/4/ace4fc93c9364afa9ee2b2b81ee91ef0/artifacts`

@bkolb249 Can you launch the server with this command:

```
mlflow server \
    --host 0.0.0.0 \
    --port 5000 \
    --backend-store-uri postgresql://user:pw@endpoint \
    --artifacts-destination s3://folder/artifacts/ \
    --serve-artifacts \
    👇👇👇 (remove this line)
    --default-artifact-root mlflow-artifacts:/
```

and create a new experiment, and then log artifacts?
